intro: Tragacantha michauxii, commonly known as the Michaux's tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces a yellowish gum resin, which has been historically used in various medicinal and industrial applications. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Tragacantha michauxii is a perennial shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter.
